E242ABE032CD4F4C8295514F2D2CCA45.description: Differentiate between types of Penetration testing (e.g., Black box, White box, Gray box).

6DA7C167F4D64EFD83B120BA74AA3BFE.description: Apply Incident response procedures (e.g., Preparation, Incident identification, Escalation and notification, Mitigation steps, Lessons learned, Reporting, Recovery procedures, First responder, Incident isolation, Quarantine, Device removal, Data breach).

E29789FA934C4852AAB4AF50548E9C4D.description: Use discovery tools and utilities to identify threats (e.g., Protocol analyzer, Vulnerability scanner, Honeypots, Honeynets, Port scanner).

F407601351C14DA5A4235123A99447B5.description: Differentiate between detection controls and prevention controls (e.g., IDS vs. IPS, Camera vs. guard).

34884BD8BA5E4C478E14DDF4510A2B28.description: Countermeasures: Use countermeasures to monitor systems and reduce risk.

146E8D0AE4654ADB92AD83DC1082C3E4.description: Maintain chain of custody on evidence.

BF90C45A750543ADB67210B9B5C727C4.description: Collect digital evidence according to established policies and protocols (e.g., system image, packet captures).

11A9138D9456455D857137DDDCB2B64B.description: Recognize digital reconnaissance techniques (e.g., packet capture, OS fingerprinting, topology discovery, DNS harvesting).

EC0394B183974B11934E678A60583658.description: Digital Forensics: Capture and analyze information using digital tools.

3864F5CDFF094FEFA3747F9B6BA8CC3A.description: Describe, appraise for, and mitigate Social Engineering attacks (e.g., Shoulder surfing, Dumpster diving, Tailgating, Impersonation, Hoaxes, Phishing, Spear Phishing, Whaling, Vishing, Principles, URL hijacking, Watering Hole).

813F7CFC492645769F9E1BDB1FC87585.description: Describe and discover vulnerabilities to and mitigate network attacks. (e.g., Man-in-the-middle, DDoS, DoS, Replay, Smurf attack, Spoofing, Spam, Phishing, Spim, Spit and other attacks).

FFFFB305AE0D4210BC5A835F139B1260.description: Describe, locate, and mitigate security threats (e.g., Adware, Viruses, Spyware, Trojan, Rootkits, Logic bomb, Botnets, Ransomware, Polymorphic malware).

7B7F1A074EB74F86A9D500261307A139.description: Differentiate between Server-side vs. client-side validation.

573F503BFBF44ECE960FC36D7A7A61EB.description: Identify application vulnerabilities (e.g., Cross-site scripting, SQL injection, LDAP injection, XML injection, Directory traversal/command injection, Buffer overflow, Integer overflow, Zero-day, Cookies and attachments, Locally Shared Objects (LSOs), Flash cookies, Malicious add-ons, Session hijacking, Header manipulation, Arbitrary code execution/remote code execution).

FA5F7425CC444DEC98A7D804FF837AF7.description: Application Development Security: Develop and maintain application security.

5FD50F786DF84515B666B9ECBAAE727E.description: Identify types of controls (e.g., Deterrent, Preventive, Detective, Compensating, Technical, and Administrative).

E07C487868C94E1BAA3D88BED424EDCF.description: Describe the concepts of malware attack vectors.

408BE3A645544894A6664F6C188DE276.description: Identify the goals, objectives and purposes of cybersecurity.

C19E7A44A597410F835BE13EB8E0FDC4.description: Cybersecurity: Examine and employ principles of cybersecurity.

A9CDA27C2F9E47D297B66518DE7F251B.description: Cybersecurity: Learners apply principles of cybersecurity to secure and defend information technology systems, selection and implementation of methods and tools to secure physical and digital assets, mange threats, deploy countermeasures, and establish strategies to protect business information using risk and incident management.

CEBC3A2544A74B6B92EB838CFB8F6EA3.description: Identify the class of network to which a given address belongs.

21B3CC181537404D87554624BD9464D4.description: Identify Class A, B, and C reserved (i.e., private) address ranges and why they are used.

F278A2A6E2504609B37A9020D87EC2FB.description: Explain the IP addressing scheme and how it is used.

420B6B27DBC344059AC7D69192281B54.description: Explain Fully Qualified Domain Names (FQDNs) and how they are used.

73BD31BAB15142FF9FC57D5811047B20.description: Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP): Describe IP addressing schemes and create subnet masks.

3E110FBE04B64B2BAAEF19F7E3FD9AC5.description: Select and install access points, wireless Network Interface Cards (NICs), antennas, and other hardware and software components to provide a wireless networking solution as determined by a site and customer survey.

479EF7E5F00445CC88D2DDC42F836CDA.description: Describe the Service Set Identifier (SSID) as used in wireless communications.

062922C76EDB483983AB669E8FFCB501.description: Wireless Network Solutions: Explain wireless communications.

E7D183C6CA2D4B399A26FB2C72BF22A6.description: Compare wireless standards in common use (e.g., Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers [IEEE] 802.11, Cellular, Bluetooth, Worldwide Interoperability for Microwave Access [WiMAX], Radio Frequency Identification [RFID], Near Field Communication [NFC]).

10F16EC6EEFB4473B0D900279401A787.description: Identify the advantages and disadvantages of cabling systems.

B19F971DCD5C4B10AD3890A41C4216ED.description: Describe types of media connectors (e.g., Bayonet Neill-Concelman [BNC], Registered Jack [RJ]-45, LC, ST) and grounding techniques.

EE3BB4C98EA14FCB9688A4C8A840904F.description: Compare media categories (e.g., single mode, multimode, CAT5, CAT5E, CAT6+).

AD5A239965CE4E3AB650AB593C53FEEC.description: Differentiate between media types (e.g., coaxial, twisted pair, fiber optic) and interfaces.

FF83ED8485414DDFA48A09D07F58DB1C.description: Identify the criteria used in selecting media (e.g., physical properties, transmission technologies, transmission span, bandwidth, topology, security, noise immunity, installation considerations, cost).

5FBBAF535BCD45918B08329A4D566ACD.description: Network Media Select, assemble, terminate, and test media.

795DCD7B032845369502A5721D4E0160.description: Describe actions to be performed at each of the Open Systems Interconnection physical layers.

14AFBD5CE9514EA2923451D5D71F9B44.description: Compare the seven layers of the Open Systems Interconnection stack to the four layers of the Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP) stack.

002BDA313C6A4FA682578577AB73DDA0.description: Open Systems Interconnection: Describe the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) standard (International Organization for Standardization [ISO] Standard 7498).

8B83E97CA8BA440A83E413F524C92BC6.description: Configure and build a network. (e.g., server, switch, router)

0A73E3F8F5534E88848117CA3CB008F6.description: Identify standard and emerging network technologies (e.g., broadband, satellite, optic, cellular, Local-Area Network (LAN) and WiFi).

12FC326E48764451B2E636FF41D89237.description: Determine the basic point-to-point (PTP) and point-to-multipoint (PTMP) network topologies (e.g., star, ring, tree, mesh, hybrid) and identify broadband and baseband (e.g., Ethernet) transmission methods and standards.

978A0697A5844908B834908B91C98ED2.description: Network Infrastructure: Build a multinode network.

7FEF730F83CA4072AD8FF70B6DBFDF90.description: Infrastructure Systems: Learners apply principles of networking and infrastructure related to the installation, administration, and maintenance of computer networks and components. Knowledge and skills may be applied to network connectivity, cabling, protocols, architecture, classification, topologies, operating systems, Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) standards, data encoding, Quality of Service (QoS), Internet Protocol (IP) addressing, and wide area network (WAN) design.

A583980ADCE14AE2A42E884C7828AE02.description: Implement and test the security of a wireless network.

B16305FED1B1439AAFCB051FF9B1913C.description: Describe security practices and policies for personal devices.

C6813CF5C21541BCAEB64BCACA5DE88C.description: Describe wireless security risks (e.g., unauthorized access) and how to mitigate them.

719EB122ADA0439B85FE8D8CE4795AAE.description: Wireless Security: Implement secure wireless networks.

F849DE3D60474CCC884AAA85CA8E3FD7.description: Identify the components of human security (e.g., social engineering) and techniques to mitigate human security threats (e.g., policies, procedures, training).

502467C83E13498CB896F0FA0B631103.description: Multilayer Defense Structure: Explain information technology mechanisms as they apply to a multilayer defense structure.

2F8445A2A7AD4CD0BE3943982BDF1225.description: Describe the functions and uses of patch management.

FD2AF776325E46BDA817217E7252E858.description: Assess risks based on vulnerability of the organization, likelihood of risk, and impact on the organization.

6C1410ACBB61443DA0EB11CEC0DF495A.description: Describe network security policies (e.g., acceptable use policy).

AC3B4BE1B75C459E8BB45ED8A5C5A341.description: Network Security: Implement and maintain network security.

9C9C6FA17AFF4B6F93232D27774BC351.description: Identify the need for disaster recovery policies and procedures.

33482B0604214E0EA5203DCC1E027128.description: Identify and implement data and application security.

3921A3C5F0CB48318A4BE4883217C686.description: Implement and maintain general security compliance.: Describe the components associated with information security systems.

8F168962BB474D71A3188D377E9B6261.description: Describe Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) using tunneling protocols (e.g., Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol [L2TP], Secure Socket Tunneling Protocol [SSTP], Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol [PPTP] and encrypting techniques).

019DF559304A4743A6F763EA4A7B3550.description: Compare authentication techniques (e.g. single factor, multifactor, passwords, biometrics, certificates, Radio Frequency Identification [RFID] cards).

76CFBB11A0C84B9EB15F4F2391232A6C.description: Components of Information Security: Describe the components associated with information security systems.

356743696F48409D8E7053E6BA61ECEF.description: Information Security: Learners apply principles of information security to implement and maintain security compliance and network security. Learners select components and mechanisms required for a multilayer defense structure and evaluate and minimize security risks to wired and wireless networks and devices.

AEC415710E3F4108B2425899FA442FA9.description: Describe emerging technologies (e.g., Bring your Own Device [BYOD], Services Virtualization, Augmented Reality [AR], SMART Devices, Additive Manufacturing [3D Printing]).

13D8C73FC93547FBBA29AB6D8FDF304B.description: Describe the differences, advantages, and limitations of cloud computing (e.g., public cloud, private cloud, hybrid cloud) and on-premises computing.

3FDBD5E609F74E7A81B3375F5512589F.description: Investigate the scope and the impact of mobile computing environments on society.

81F3DE3C583D4CBEBF34A441BC475840.description: Emerging Technologies: Identify trending technologies, their fundamental architecture, and their value in the marketplace.

F76723D1467C475BA509B676D768DC70.description: Identify the need for personal security in digital information and describe how personal information can be safeguarded.

DC6300AAFE774DF4BE7D30196A637C99.description: Describe computer forensics, its importance in information security and cybersecurity, and its relevance to law enforcement.

DEC52464EF2B4898AA1CEAA73DD741B0.description: Describe major threats to computer systems (e.g., insider threats, viruses, worms, spyware, ransomware, spoofing, hacking, social engineering, phishing).

B2633B212E9B4EECB2F2C265630A909C.description: Explain the need for confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) of information.

35C587568D7D4F559B531E5D0F500356.description: Security, Risks, and Safeguards: Describe the need for security and explain security risks and security safeguards.

9E6E3D847CBC406CB4B4E0825B7317BA.description: IT Fundamentals: Learners apply fundamental principles of IT, including the history of IT and its impact on society, common industry terms, systems theory, information storage and retrieval, database management, and computer hardware, software, and peripheral device configuration and installation. This base of knowledge and skills may be applied across the career field.

595F0DEF5E6643FA856A4B6C683976E5.description: Apply physical and virtual situational awareness (e.g., clean desk policies, shoulder surfing, social engineering, tailgating).

6048243170164DB3942453727623CB67.description: Interpret security policies through job specific training and training updates.

951EAFB2CB1E425A98C6730165DC445C.description: Cyberhygeine: Apply digital information security principles to keep information secure.

F9477638BAAF4ED68AB654BFF252608F.description: Business Operations/21st Century Skills: Learners apply principles of economics, business management, marketing, and employability in an entrepreneur, manager, and employee role to the leadership, planning, developing, and analyzing of business enterprises related to the career field.
